intro: Conosilene conica var. carpathae, commonly known as the Carpathian conosilene, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant exhibits a distinctive conical shape, giving it its scientific name, and has lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
